column5: Sample Question
column6: Example Prospect Answer

column5: “How does investing in yourself feel right now?”
column6: “It feels overwhelming. I’m scared to make that decision.”

column5: “Have you spent this much before?”
column6: “Not really. I’m not sure how I feel about it.”

column5: “What’s your gut reaction to this investment?”
column6: “I feel confident. This is an investment I’m ready to make.”

column5: “Does the budget feel like a stretch?”
column6: “Yes. Our CFO is nervous.”

column5: “Any emotional hesitations from leadership?”
column6: “They want more proof before spending.”

column5: “How does your team feel about allocating this budget?”
column6: “Everyone agrees it’s worth it for the goal.”

column5: “How do you feel about spending to prep the house?”
column6: “I don’t want to spend anything else.”

column5: “Are you okay with investing in staging or repairs?”
column6: “I guess... if it’s really necessary.”

column5: “Are you comfortable putting money in to get a higher return?”
column6: “Absolutely. I’m good with that.”

column5: “Any concerns about the offer as it stands?”
column6: “Can you give me a discount or payment plan?”

column5: “Do you want to explore other pricing options?”
column6: “Maybe — is there a smaller program or a bonus?”

column5: “Do the terms feel good as-is?”
column6: “Yes — I’m all in if this solves my issue.”

column5: “Is pricing a blocker at this stage?”
column6: “We need a price cut to even consider this.”

column5: “Do you see any terms that might need adjusting?”
column6: “We’d want some internal buy-in or modifications.”

column5: “Are you comfortable with our offer as it stands?”
column6: “Yes — we’re good to roll out if it fits.”

column5: “Any concerns with commission or fees?”
column6: “Can you lower your commission?”

column5: “Is the fee structure acceptable?”
column6: “We might want to revisit after listing.”

column5: “Are you aligned on terms and pricing?”
column6: “Yes — we’re happy with the terms as-is.”

column5: “Do you need a different format or refund option?”
column6: “I need flexibility or guarantees to feel okay.”

column5: “Would flexible terms change how you feel?”
column6: “Maybe… I’d feel better with some options.”

column5: “How do you feel about the structure as-is?”
column6: “It works. The value matters more than the format.”

column5: “Do our terms fit your procurement needs?”
column6: “No — we can’t accept the current structure.”

column5: “Would you need internal review before approval?”
column6: “Yes — legal would need to look at it.”

column5: “Can we move forward as-is?”
column6: “Yes — we’re ready to proceed.”

column5: “Do you need flexible staging/commission/closing options?”
column6: “Yes — we need max flexibility.”

column5: “Would you be open to structure changes later?”
column6: “Yes — we can revisit if needed.”

column5: “Are you good with the listing structure and timeline?”
column6: “Yes — happy to proceed as planned.”
